title.narrative: Provision of settlement NFIs to flood-affected populations in Eldueim locality, White Nile state

description.narrative:
CAFOD, in partnership with Sub-Sahara International Development Organization (SIDO), (as the implementing agency) and in collaboration with Shelter and NFIs sector lead, other actors and the affected population, will respond to the Settlement NFI needs of 1,483 flood affected households in Eldueim locality, White Nile State, by providing them with settlement Non-Food Items. The funding for the project is from Rapid Response Fund (RRF) a funding facility under-OFDA (US government funds). The Settlement Non-Food Items to be provided to the selected beneficiaries will be 1 Jerry-can, 2 blankets, 2 plastic sheets, 2 sleeping mats, 6 pieces of soap, and 1 set of HH utensils. Project Outcome: To address emergency NFIs needs of 1,483 affected HHs by floods in Eldueim locality, White Nile Expected Output: 1,483 HHs (at least 8,898 people) provided with Shelter and Settlement NFIs (plastic sheets, blankets, jerrycans, sleeping mats and soap and HH utensil set) to meet their emergency needs. Project Activties include: i.Beneficiary identification/development of beneficiary list ii.Procurement of items, warehousing, packaging, and transportation: iii.Coordination with relevant partners regarding distribution of NFIs. iv.Distribution of Settlement NFIs to the beneficiaries . v.3-day training for 18 community volunteers on cholera prevention and control . vi.Thirty community sensitization meetings – 30 community sensitization meetings . vii.Post Distribution Monitoring (PDM) . viii.Communication, branding and visibility
CAFOD will be undertaking all procurement on behalf of the partner. The institutional donor recommend that CAFOD take lead of the procurement. The NFIs items includes: plastic sheets, blankets, jerry cans, sleeping mats and soap and HH utensil set) to meet their emergency needs. This as per donor requirements- see project agreements between IOM- and CAFOD.
